properties.name: Parking Jam
properties.description:
Swipe cars into the road to clear the parking lot.  
Relieve stress by crashing the cars into each other.
Enable speedrun mode to compete on the leaderboard!

This is a game template for GDevelop, a no-code, open-source, free, and easy game-making app
properties.author: GDevelop

events.comment: Add color tint to objects
Change car image by selecting a random frame in the animation
Set variables that control the speed of cars
Load score from storage (so players can see how many cars they have saved)
Enable speedrun if it was previously enabled
Add color when mouse is over text
Display leaderboard
Play a sound, wait a fraction of a second for the sound to finish, and then change levels

objects.name: Tutorial_Text
objects.string:
Drag cars into the road 
to clear the parking lot

events.comment: Fade out objects once a click or touch is released

objects.name: EndMessage_Text
objects.string:
You did it!  

The cars are now free

  to roam the streets

objects.name: OpenGDevelop_Text
objects.string:
Click here
to edit this
game in
GDevelop

events.comment: Create cars at random locations near the bottom of the screen.  Give them a random angle and shoot them upwards.
Delete cars that fall far below the screen (to reduce memory and CPU usage)
Hide objects for a few seconds
Change tint color of both objects when either one is under mouse cursor
Remove color tint
Change color when button is pressed
Remove color tint
Fade text and sound volume
Hide submit button after score is submitted
If score submission failed, allow player to submit score again
If score submission succeeded, show leaderboard and start title screen
Create a joint that will only let the car slide in one direction (left/right or up/down) and save the joint ID as an object variable
Set starting level
Change car images by selecting a random frame in the animation
Set variables that control the speed of cars
Update text
Prepare End Screen
Adjust color of objects

events.name: Detect when car leaves the parking lot

events.comment: Don't allow player to interact with car anymore. This will "release" the car if it was being dragged.
Delete the prismatic joint so that car motion is no longer restricted
Animate a coin with sound effects and update score
Move and rotate car based on which objects it is touching (and not touching)
Delete cars when they leave the screen
Only apply effects when cars are not driving on the road
Shake objects and create dust particles
Always play the crash impact sound
20% chance to play the glass breaking sound also
Detect when all cars have left the screen (and been deleted)
Save score to storage (so it will remain even after game restarts)
Head to the next level
Pause only works before the level is completed
Change pause to the opposite state (on/off)
Go back to title screen
Unpause scene
Hide timer if speedrun is not enabled
Always keep track of time so user has choice to submit to leaderboard
Start timer when touching screen
Update timer text
Stop timer when cars are all gone

events.name: DEBUG: Change game levels by pressing numbers on numpad.  Enable this event group to use.

events.comment: Change tint color of button when it is under mouse cursor
Remove color tint
Change color when button is pressed
Remove color tint

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Silver-Streak, @Bouh, Tristan Rhodes
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension adds conditions to check if an object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.

Note that this does not take into account any object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, but can be combined with those existing conditions.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: IsOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This adds a condition to detect if an object is on screen based off its current layer.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
This behavior provides a condition to check if the object is located within the visible portion of its layer's camera. The condition also allows for specifying padding to the virtual screen border.
Note that object visibility, such as being hidden or 0 opacity, is not considered (but you can use those existing conditions in addition to this behavior).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: InOnScreen

eventsFunctions.description: Checks if an object position is within the viewport of its layer.
eventsFunctions.name: IsOnScreen

parameters.longDescription: Number of pixels to pad the screen border. Zero by default. A negative value goes inside the screen, a positive value go outside.
parameters.name: Padding

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: add_, @Jurfix
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Expressions:
 - Mathematical constants
 - Greatest common factor/Lowest common multiple
 - Factorial
 - Coordinates conversion for polar and isometric systems
 - ToFixedString: Formats a number into a string with the specified number of decimal places
 - ToFixed: (Deprecated) Formats a number to use the specified number of decimal places

Conditions:
- IsEven: Check if the number is even (divisible by 2)

Release Notes:

Version 1.0.7
- Added ToFixedString()
- Deprecated ToFixed() because it does not show any trailing zeros for whole numbers. Prefer using ToFixedString() to set values in text objects.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedMath
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Additional math functions and constants as expressions and conditions.

parameters.description: Y value of the second point
parameters.name: y2

parameters.name: min2

parameters.description: The highest value of the second range

eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = Math.PI / 2;

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Add this behavior to a shape painter object.

When the toggle switch is in the *left* position, the condition `Checked` is "false". If it is in the *right* position, the condition `Checked` is true.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the toggle switch.

Toggle switch cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Toggle switch is hidden
- Toggle switch's layer is hidden
- Toggle switch is disabled

Toggle switch can always be changed by an action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ToggleSwitch
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Toggle switch that users can click or touch.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Use a shape-painter object to draw a toggle switch that users can click or touch.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ToggleSwitch

events.comment: Fix bad inputs that create malformed toggle switches
Animate the thumb to the right place
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Reset scene variable
Set inactive track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw inactive track
Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw active track
Draw halo when the mouse is hovering over thumb
Use darker halo while being pressed
Drop Shadow
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Make sure object doesn't get re-drawn every frame

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

Add the behavior to a Text object (BBText, Bitmap Text object) and choose the interval between characters.

* When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
* You can change the speed of the text typing by changing the interval with events.
* Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
* You can also pause the typing and resume it after.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for texts ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Add the behavior to the object, and it will get animated when the text is changed. You can also pause/resume it.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Provides values based on picked object instances.  
Useful for camera tracking, flocking behaviors, and more.

Included expressions

Center points:
- X center point (absolute) 
- Y center point (absolute)
- X center point (average) 
- Y center point (average)

Based on AABB of objects:
- Minimum X position
- Minimum Y position
- Maximum X position
- Maximum Y position

Force expressions:
- Average horizontal force (X)
- Average vertical force (Y)

Angle expressions:
- Average angle of rotation

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.
By default, movement will slow down when going around corners, but this can be changed to always use a constant speed.

Example uses:
- Moveable platforms
- Enemy movement patterns

Properties:
- Center of movement, X position
- Center of movement, Y position
- Horizontal distance
- Vertical distance
- Horizontal speed
- Vertical speed
- Use constant speed (object will not slow down at corners)
- Use counter-clockwise direction

Tips:
- Set the CenterX and CenterY values to move the object
- For horizontal movement only, set vertical distance to 0
- For vertical movement only, set horizontal distance to 0
- Use conditions to apply logic based on the direction the object is moving.  For example, setting the animation.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangularMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allow an object to move in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangularMovement

Horizontal movement is the same for both methods
Vertical movement is reversed based on the parameter
Skip if no horizontal movement is desired
Record direction
Skip if no vertical movement is desired
Record direction
Skip if no horizontal movement is desired
Record direction
Skip if no vertical movement is desired
Record direction
Reset the counter after the rectangular path is completed
Vertical movement is the same for both methods
Record direction
Record direction
Detect when Progress crosses 0 (or if horizontal movement is disabled)
Record direction
Detect when Progress crosses 0 (or if vertical movement is disabled)
Record direction

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position: Shake the X and/or Y position of the object 
- Angle: Shake the angle (rotation) of the object 
- Scale: Shake the scale of the object (must be a sprite)

Control how the object shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the object moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the object
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each movement of the object
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Object is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)

Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale).
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Enables users to click and drag on objects to move them.  The object will retain velocity when the click is released, which can allow users to fling objects across the screen.

Note:
- The standard "draggable" behavior will not work on objects that have the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggablePhysics

events.comment: Create mouse joints and save the joint ID
Update the position of the mouse joint to follow the mouse
Delete the mouse joint when released or if pressed and moved outside of screen

eventsFunctions.description: Check if object is being dragged.
